channel.title: COVID on Columbia DSI Scholars
channel.description: Recent content in COVID on Columbia DSI Scholars

item.title: Can we detect COVID in the Internet?
item.description: COVID-19 has changed the way we use the internet, from taking classes to social interactions and entertainment. The FCC publishes a large dataset of network measurements from thousands of homes, with gigabytes of data. The project goal is to analyze the data and answer questions such as: Has the increased usage reduced internet speeds? Can we tell how much people are staying at home from data usage records? Is the increased use of video conferencing reflected in the upload metrics?

item.title: Phenotyping COVID-19 patients using NLP and clinical notes
item.description: Our lab is using clinical notes to phenotype COVID patient outcomes. The aim is to better understand the sequela of COVID-19 from clinical notes.
